abstract: The chairman of the House Agriculture Committee complains that the regulator “has taken a vague and minimalist approach” to conducting cost-benefit analyses.
snippet: The chairman of the House Agriculture Committee complains that the regulator “has taken a vague and minimalist approach” to conducting cost-benefit analyses.
lead_paragraph: Republican lawmakers are stepping up their criticism on federal regulators charged with writing new rules for Wall Street, saying the agencies are ignoring the costs of the rules.

headline.main: Republicans Assail Regulator on Costs of New Rules

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
